Class Series

  • java.lang.Object
    • Series
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Series
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Lab 5, CS 2334, Section 010, 21 March 2017

    This class models a series (such as a TV series). A series consists of a title, a start year for the series, an end year for the series (if any; 0 if the series is still going), and a collection of episodes.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Dean Hougen and (Your Name)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Series

        public Series()
        This is the default constructor for Series. It instantiates the class with default values for the fields.

      • Series

        public Series(java.lang.String title,
              int startYear,
              int endYear)
        This is the basic constructor for Series. It instantiates the class with user supplied values for series title and start and end years.

        Parameters:
        title - The title of the Series.
        startYear - The first year that the Series aired.
        endYear - The last year that the Series aired.

      • Series

        public Series(java.lang.String title,
              int startYear,
              int endYear,
              java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,Episode> episodeMap)
        This is an advanced constructor for Series. It instantiates the class with user supplied values for series title and start and end years and also a LinkedHashMap of Episodes.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the Series.
        startYear - The first year that the Series aired.
        endYear - The last year that the Series aired.
        episodeMap - The LinkedHashMap of Episodes.

    • Method Detail

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Accessor method for title.
        Returns:
        The series title.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String name)
        Mutator method for title.
        Parameters:
        name - The title to set for the series.

      • getStartYear

        public int getStartYear()
        Accessor method for start year.
        Returns:
        The year the series started.

      • setStartYear

        public void setStartYear(int startYear)
        Mutator method for start year.
        Parameters:
        startYear - The year to set as the starting year.

      • getEndYear

        public int getEndYear()
        Accessor method for the end year.
        Returns:
        The year the series ended.

      • setEndYear

        public void setEndYear(int endYear)
        Mutator method for end year.
        Parameters:
        endYear - The year to set as the ending year.

      • getEpisodeArray

        public Episode[] getEpisodeArray()
        Accessor method for the collection of episodes.

        Note that returning an array of the episode values, rather than a reference to the map itself, helps to preserve encapsulation.

        Returns:
        An array of the episodes in the episodeMap.

      • getEpisodeMap

        public java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,Episode> getEpisodeMap()
        Accessor method for the collection of episodes.

        Note that returning a reference to the episode map itself does NOT help to preserve encapsulation.

        Returns:
        An array of the episodes in the episodeMap.

      • setEpisodeMap

        public void setEpisodeMap(java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,Episode> episodeMap)
        A mutator method for the collection of episodes. This one sets the entire map of episodes to be the map passed in.

        Note that simply allowing our map of episodes to be replaced by another map does NOT help to preserve encapsulation.

        Parameters:
        episodeMap - The collection of episodes to set.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String title)
        A method to determine whether an episode with a specified title is in the collection of episodes.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the episode to look for in the collection.
        Returns:
        true if the episode name is already in the collection, false otherwise.

      • getEpisodeString

        public java.lang.String getEpisodeString(java.lang.String title)
        An accessor that gets an episode based on title and returns the information on that episode as a String.

        Note that if an episode with the given title does not exist in the map, this method will throw a null pointer exception.

        Parameters:
        title - The title of the episode to look for in the collection.
        Returns:
        The found episode converted to a String.

      • addEpisode

        public boolean addEpisode(Episode episode)
        A mutator method for the collection of episodes. This one adds a single episode, then returns a boolean value of true to indicate that the episode was successfully added. If the episode was already present, adding fails, so a boolean value of false is returned.
        Parameters:
        episode - The episode to add to the episodeMap.

      • replaceEpisode

        public boolean replaceEpisode(Episode episode)
        A mutator method for the collection of episodes. This one replaces a single episode, then returns a boolean value of true to indicate that the episode was successfully replaced. If the episode was not already present, replacing fails, so a boolean value of false is returned.
        Parameters:
        episode - The episode to replace in the episodeMap.

      • clearEpisodes

        public void clearEpisodes()
        A mutator method for the collection of episodes. This one throws away any existing collection of episodes and puts an empty collection in its place.

      • saveEpisodeMap

        public void saveEpisodeMap()
                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Saves the current episode map to a file named "Startrek.dat"
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException

      • loadEpisodeMap

        public void loadEpisodeMap()
                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                           java.io.IOException,
                           java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Loads an episode map from a file named "Startrek.dat"
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • printEpisodes

        public void printEpisodes()
        Prints all episodes in the episode map in a human-readable format
